negate_explanation: Negates the search expression, giving only sentences that do not match.
about_body: Korp is Språkbanken's word research platform. For more information, comments or suggestions, contact us.
about_cite: If you use Korp in your work, please cite us.
warning_body: The dependency relations illustrated herein are the result of automated parsing.
fail_contact: If you have questions, or you want to report a bug, please contact sb-info@svenska.gu.se.
active_cqp_simple: Active CQP query in simple search
show_context_help: By default, search hits are listed in a keywords-in-context layout (KWIC). Enabling this option will instead show them with wrapped lines, suitable for reading. For some corpora, this also retrieves more of the context, such as a full paragraph.
login_help: An account is only necessary if you need to access protected corpora. To apply for access, email sb-info@svenska.gu.se and let us know what corpora you are interested in.
login_fail_msg: Authentication failed, please check your username and password and try again.
word_pic_bad_search: For a word picture, the search query must be exactly one word or lemgram.
word_pic_global_filter: The word picture cannot be combined with global filters. Please clear the filters to continue.
word_pic_description: The Word picture shows words that tend to co-occur in syntactic relations with the search word.
word_pic_result_description: The part of speech of the search word determines what relations to show. Each list collects words that occur in the selected corpora and in the given relation to the search word.
stat_lmi_help: Lexicographer's Mutual Information, an adaptation of the Mutual Information association measure prioritizing typical items over infrequent ones
map_no_data: Selected corpora have no geographical data.
map_relative_help: Make map marker sizes relative to location prevalence in the corpus selection.
following_text: Match any of the following rules:
within_warn: not all selected corpora support extended context
stats_clipped_help: The total number of rows was larger, but the least frequent rows were skipped for better performance.
non_time_after: of selected material lacks time data.
material_warn: The selected corpora lack time data.
graph_material_tooltip: The selected corpora lack time data for the shadowed periods.
relative_help: Relative frequency shows the number of hits per million tokens in selected corpora. This is helpful when comparing searches in corpora of different sizes.
compare_warning: Please save two searches in order to perform comparison. Look for the arrow next to the search button.
hitspicture_gotocorpushits: Click to go to the first page with hits from this corpus.
formatdescr_csv: Comma-Separated Values, sentence per row, e.g., for importing to a spreadsheet. Each row has a corpus id, match position, left context, matching tokens, right context and text attributes. The match and contexts contain tokens without attributes.
download_annotations_csv: One token per row with annotations (CSV)
formatdescr_csvp: Comma-Separated Values, token per row, e.g., for importing to a spreadsheet. Each row has one text token with attributes and a potential search hit indicator. Each found sentence is preceded by a line with a corpus ID, corpus position and text attributes for the sentence.
formatdescr_tsv: Tab-Separated Values, sentence per line, e.g., for processing with Unix-style text tools. Each sentence is on its own line, with fields containing the corpus id, match position, left context, matching tokens, right context and text attributes. The match and contexts contain tokens without attributes.
download_annotations_tsv: One token per row with annotations (TSV)
formatdescr_vrt: VeRticalized Text: Corpus Workbench input format: each row contains one token with attributes, and structures are marked with XML-like elements.
formatdescr_text: Plain text with matches marked: sentence per line, tokens without attributes, text attributes shown
formatdescr_annot: Annotated text as an Excel spreadsheet (XLS), token per row. Each row has one text token with attributes and a potential search hit indicator. Each found sentence is preceded by a line with a corpus ID, corpus position and text attributes for the sentence.
formatdescr_nooj: XML import format for the NooJ software
formatdescr_ref: Bibliographical references as an Excel spreadsheet (XLS) with each matching sentence on its own line, followed by the text attributes of the sentence on their own lines
no_row_selected_map: Choose at least one row to show the map
repeat_error: Error: Not possible to repeat from 0 for all tokens.
order_error: Error: The "in free order" option requires multiple tokens, no repetition, no boundaries and no wildcards.
order_help: The "in free order" option is compatible with queries that have multiple tokens, no repetition, no boundaries and no wildcards.
access_partly_denied: You do not have access to some corpora that you have selected
access_partly_denied_continue: To be able to continue, they will be removed.
access_denied: You do not have access to any corpus in this mode.
corpus_not_available: Some selected corpora are not available, and have been removed from selection.
stats_not_in_order_warn: Statistics currently do not support the "in free order" search option.
free_order_chk_help: The search words can occur in any order, and not necessarily in sequence.
prefix_chk_help: Allow words that begin with the search words.
midfix_chk_help: Allow words that contain the search words.
suffix_chk_help: Allow words that end with the search words.
